meanings.definition: Concealed one's true motives or feelings
meanings.sent1: She dissembled her disappointment with a smile.
meanings.sent2: He dissembled his fear by pretending to be brave.
meanings.sent3: The magician dissembled his trick to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The chameleon dissembled its color to blend into the surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The spy dissembled his identity to remain undercover.

meanings.definition: Pretended or acted in a deceptive manner
meanings.sent1: The dissembled smile on her face fooled no one.
meanings.sent2: His dissembled kindness hid his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The dissembled innocence of the child made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The dissembled calmness of the storm was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The dissembled appearance of the painting revealed its true beauty.
